Wisdom: أَعْلَمُ النَّاسِ بِاللَّهِ أَرْضَاهُمْ بِقَضَائِهِ
enWisdom: The most learned of people about Allah, the Glorified, are the most satisfied with His decree

Wisdom: إِنْ عَقَدْتَ إِيمَانَكَ فَارْضَ بِالْمَقْضِيِّ عَلَيْكَ وَلَا تَرْجُ أَحَداً إِلَّا اللَّهَ سُبْحَانَهُ وَانْتَظِرْ مَا أَتَاكَ بِهِ الْقَدَرُ
enWisdom: If you have made a covenant [to believe in Allah] then be satisfied with that which has been decreed against you and for you, and do not have hope in anyone other than Allah, the Glorified, and await that which is brought to you by [divine] decree

Wisdom: شَرُّ الْأُمُورِ السَّخَطُ [التَّسَخُّطُ] لِلْقَضَاءِ
enWisdom: The worst of things is displeasure with the divine decree

Wisdom: مَنْ لَمْ يَرْضَ بِالْقَضَاءِ دَخَلَ الْكُفْرُ دِينَهُ
enWisdom: Whoever is not satisfied with the decree [of Allah], disbelief seeps into his religion

Wisdom: مَا دَفَعَ اللَّهُ سُبْحَانَهُ عَنِ الْمُؤْمِنِ شَيْئاً مِنْ بَلَاءِ الدُّنْيَا وَعَذَابِ الْآخِرَةِ إِلَّا بِرِضَاهُ بِقَضَائِهِ وَحُسْنِ صَبْرِهِ عَلَى بَلَائِهِ
enWisdom: Allah, the Glorified, does not repel any of the afflictions of this world and chastisements of the Hereafter from the believer except because of his satisfaction with His decree and his good patience in the face of His trials

Wisdom: إِنَّ مَنْ شَغَلَ نَفْسَهُ بِالْمَفْرُوضِ عَلَيْهِ عَنِ الْمَضْمُونِ لَهُ وَرَضِيَ بِالْمَقُدورِ عَلَيْهِ وَلَهُ كَانَ أَكْثَرَ النَّاسِ سَلَامَةً فِي عَافِيَةٍ وَرِبْحاً فِي غِبْطَةٍ وَغَنِيمَةً فِي مَسَرَّةٍ
enWisdom: Verily whoever busies himself with what is obligatory upon him instead of that which has been guaranteed for him, and is satisfied with what has been decreed for and against him; he will be the healthiest person in wellbeing, the most profiting from felicity and the most benefitting from happiness

Wisdom: كُنْ أَبَداً رَاضِياً بِمَا يَأْتِي بِهِ الْقَدَرُ
enWisdom: Always be pleased with what is brought by [divine] decree

Wisdom: مَنْ تَسَخَّطَ بِالْمَقُدورِ حَلَّ بِهِ الْمَحْذُورُ
enWisdom: Whoever is displeased with what has been destined, adversity befalls him

Wisdom: مَنْ أَيْقَنَ بِالْقَدَرِ لَمْ يَكْتَرِثْ بِمَا نَابَهُ
enWisdom: One who is certain about destiny is not disturbed by what befalls him

Wisdom: مَنْ رَضِيَ بِالْقَدَرِ لَمْ يَكْرُثْهُ الْحَذَرُ
enWisdom: One who is pleased with what has been destined [for him] is not troubled by warning

Wisdom: مِنْ أَفْضَلِ الْإِيمَانِ الرِّضَا بِمَا يَأْتِي بِهِ الْقَدَرُ
enWisdom: From the most excellent faith is being pleased with whatever [divine] decree brings

Wisdom: الرِّضَا يَنْفِي الْحُزْنَ
enWisdom: Satisfaction dispels sadness

Wisdom: الرِّضَا ثَمَرَةُ الْيَقِينِ
enWisdom: Satisfaction [with the decree of Allah] is the fruit of certitude

Wisdom: الدِّينُ شَجَرَةٌ أَصْلُهَا التَّسْلِيمُ وَالرِّضَا
enWisdom: Religion is a tree whose roots are submission and contentment

Wisdom: أَجْدَرُ الْأَشْيَاءِ بِصِدْقِ الْإِيمَانِ الرِّضَا وَالتَّسْلِيمُ
enWisdom: The thing which is most befitting of true faith is being satisfied [with what has been decrees] and total submission [to Allah]

Wisdom: رَأْسُ الطَّاعَةِ الرِّضَا
enWisdom: The pinnacle of worship is satisfaction [with the decree of Allah]

Wisdom: رَزَانَةُ الْعَقْلِ تُخْتَبَرُ فِي الرِّضَا [فِي الْفَرَجِ‏] وَالْحُزْنِ
enWisdom: The staidness of the intellect is put to the test in times of happiness and sadness

Wisdom: عَلَيْكَ بِالرِّضَا فِي الشِّدَّةِ وَالرَّخَاءِ
enWisdom: Remain satisfied in times of difficulty and ease

Wisdom: غَايَةُ الدِّينِ الرِّضَا
enWisdom: The height of religion is satisfaction [with the decree of Allah]

Wisdom: كُنْ رَاضِياً تَكُنْ مَرْضِيّاً
enWisdom: Be pleased [with Allah’s decree] and He will be pleased with you

Wisdom: مَنْ لَمْ يَصْلُحْ عَلَى اخْتِيَارِ اللَّهِ [لَهُ‏] لَمْ يَصْلُحْ عَلَى اخْتِيَارِهِ لِنَفْسِهِ [نَفْسَهُ‏]
enWisdom: Whoever does not get reformed by that which Allah has chosen [for him] will not be reformed by what he chooses for himself

Wisdom: نِعْمَ قَرِينُ الْإِيمَانِ الرِّضَا
enWisdom: What a good companion of faith satisfaction is!

Wisdom: لَا إِسْلَامَ كَالرِّضَا
enWisdom: There is no submission like satisfaction [with what has been decreed]
